channel.title: Pot values, and pots with centre indents?
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I've just found a few 20k pots with centre indents in my parts drawer and have a few Q's. First, the recommendation is 470ohm-10k pots - what happens when higher k pots are used?
Annnd with the centre-indent pots, would these work reliably to return something like a +/- value k inlet on a patch to zero? For example, the same place you would place a ctrl/dial b. I'd love to use these to give +/- envelope depth on a synth patch.
Thoughts?

item.title: Pot values, and pots with centre indents?
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

With higher pots, you will have more noise on the inputs. Thus you may consider shielding.
You can convert a unipolar to a bipolar value with the dedicated object in library/convert. I don't know how well centred are your pots, thus I can't tell if the center will really be zero.

Read full topic
